projects.title: Reimagining Electronic Payment Systems for College Students
description: Project manager for Capital One & Braven. Led a team of 6 to create an innovative payment solution for college students
Utilized the design thinking process to conduct empathy-based interviews, define solutions, ideate, prototype, and test the product

projects.title: Digital Maturity and Its Impact on Restaurant Performance
projects.description: Working capstone research paper on the economics of digital maturity within the restaurant industry. End product earned me an invitation to present at the annual ECONference

projects.title: Huskie Closet Promotion
projects.description: Project manager for promoting and developing the Huskie Closet, a non-profit that provides clothing to college students. Utilized the design thinking process

awards.title: Dean's Award
awards.description: Established in 1970, this prestigious award recognizes seniors who have made outstanding contributions to their major departments within the college. Awarded to one graduating senior per year

leadership.title: The Braven Accelerator
description: Enhanced leadership and teamwork skills through a comprehensive 14-week professional development course
Designed a career roadmap by outlining 3 short-term goals and identifying resources to achieve them

leadership.title: Economic Department Ambassador
description: Invited by the Associate Dean to represent the Economics Department at Admitted Student Days
Led small group discussions and activities, employing data-driven insights to clarify academic pathways and address specific student interests

leadership.title: Economic Student Association
description: Overhauled regular meetings and restructured the association, leading to improved organizational efficiency
Programmed the ‘2024 ECONference’, uniting speakers, students, and faculty to discuss economics
Presented and conducted group research 'The Federal Funds Rate, Unemployment, and Uber'

leadership.title: Circus Club
description: Co-founded and established a club dedicated to circus skills and activities. Authored the club's constitution, organized meetings, and structured the overall program
Validated the club's status as an official entity with Northern Illinois University within the second year of operation

experience.title: Associate at Northern Illinois University
description: Trained 5+ employees in cash register operation, dining room upkeep, and customer service
Enhanced dining experiences for 100+ customers/hour with professional service and precise transactions
Applied economic concepts from capstone paper to provide insights into NIU dining performance

experience.title: Festival Assistant at Luxembourg American Cultural Society
description: Coordinated volunteers, optimizing festival support through meticulous supervision and management
Assisted in organizing activities, enhancing attendee engagement through proactive planning and changes

experience.title: Receptionist at Botto Gilbert Lancaster, PC
description: Ensured financial accuracy and compliance by handling transactions, adhering to company regulations
Coordinated communication and payroll by answering calls, entering data, and applying services knowledge
Boosted social media presence by designing and posting infographics, leading social media efforts

volunteering.title: Salvation Army
description: Assisted the Salvation Army in welcoming individuals in need and distributing food to support the hungry

volunteering.title: Piano Teacher
description: Drew upon 10 years of classical piano training to design and teach a beginner piano course, providing personalized weekly lessons. Composed original beginner piano pieces and technique-focused scores to enhance learning, foster musical creativity, and instill best practices in piano technique

side_projects.title: Music Portfolio
side_projects.description: Developed a website in HTML, CSS, and JS for showcasing original compositions and scores

skills.title: Data Analysis
description: Proficient in Excel functions and regression analysis, utilized in various research projects. Experienced in data visualization and basic econometrics in RStudio, skills developed during ECON 492. Also skilled in audio and MIDI data visualization using JavaScript, TouchDesigner, and various programming languages

skills.title: Project Management
description: Successfully managed diverse projects across various industries, leveraging tools like Slack for seamless communication, task management, and team coordination. Implemented file organization systems and best practices to streamline workflows, ensuring project deliverables were completed efficiently. Optimized team productivity by strategically assigning tasks based on individual strengths and priorities, leading to enhanced time management and project outcomes

skills.title: Communication and Presentation
description: Developed strong communication skills through presenting research findings, leading team meetings, and conveying complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences. Successfully presented at conferences and facilitated workshops, utilizing data-driven insights and visual aids to enhance understanding and engagement

endorsed_by.title: Michael Sloat - Manager at Northern Illinois University
description: Kenneth Jacksack has worked for our team at NIU. He’s a valued employee who takes a great amount of pride in his work. He’s always willing to help and doesn’t hesitate to assist others when needed, without being asked

We will miss his dedication and commitment to always doing a complete job when he was scheduled. I’m sure Kenneth will be successful in his future career as he always has pride and commitment in his work

endorsed_by.title: Recommendations Available Upon Request
